contentrichtext.text: '''Baron Rootes''', of Ramsbury in the County of Wiltshire, is a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1959 for the businessman [[William Rootes, 1st Baron Rootes|Sir William Rootes]]. He was head of the motor car manufacturer [[Rootes Group|Rootes Ltd]]. {{As of|2010}} the title is held by his grandson, the third Baron, who succeeded his father in 1992. ==Barons Rootes (1959)== *[[William Rootes, 1st Baron Rootes|William Edward Rootes, 1st Baron Rootes]] (1894–1964) *[[William Geoffrey Rootes|(William) Geoffrey Rootes, 2nd Baron Rootes]] (1917–1992) *Nicholas Geoffrey Rootes, 3rd Baron Rootes (b. 1951) ==Notes== {{unreferenced|date=February 2013}} {{reflist}} ==References== *Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). ''Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage'' (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990, {{Page needed |date=February 2013}} *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rootes}} [[Category:Baronies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]]
